title: OsmAnd ‚Äî Maps & GPS Offline
descriptionHTML:
OsmAnd is an offline world map application based on OpenStreetMap (OSM), which allows you to navigate taking into account the preferred roads and vehicle dimensions. Plan routes based on inclines and record GPX tracks without an internet connection.
OsmAnd is an open source app. We do not collect user data and you decide what data the app will have access to.

Main features:

Map view
‚Ä¢ Choice of places to be displayed on the map: attractions, food, health and more;
‚Ä¢ Search for places by address, name, coordinates, or category;
‚Ä¢ Map styles for the convenience of different activities: touring view, nautical map, winter and ski, topographic, desert, off-road, and others;
‚Ä¢ Shading relief and plug-in contour lines;
‚Ä¢ Ability to overlay different sources of maps on top of each other;

GPS Navigation
‚Ä¢ Plotting a route to a place without an Internet connection;
‚Ä¢ Customizable navigation profiles for different vehicles: cars, motorcycles, bicycles, 4x4, pedestrians, boats, public transport, and more;
‚Ä¢ Change the constructed route, taking into account the exclusion of certain roads or road surfaces;
‚Ä¢ Customizable information widgets about the route: distance, speed, remaining travel time, distance to turn, and more;

Route Planning and Recording
‚Ä¢ Plotting a route point by point using one or multiple navigation profiles;
‚Ä¢ Route recording using GPX tracks;
‚Ä¢ Manage GPX tracks: displaying your own or imported GPX tracks on the map, navigating through them;
‚Ä¢ Visual data about the route - descents/ascents, distances;
‚Ä¢ Ability to share GPX track in OpenStreetMap;

Creation of points with different functionality
‚Ä¢ Favourites;
‚Ä¢ Markers;
‚Ä¢ Audio/video notes;

OpenStreetMap
‚Ä¢ Making edits to OSM;
‚Ä¢ Updating maps with a frequency of up to one hour;

Additional features
‚Ä¢ Compass and radius ruler;
‚Ä¢ Mapillary interface;
‚Ä¢ Night theme;
‚Ä¢ Wikipedia;
‚Ä¢ Large community of users around the world, documentation, and support;

Paid features:

Maps+ (in-app or subscription)
‚Ä¢ Android Auto support;
‚Ä¢ Unlimited map downloads;
‚Ä¢ Topo data (Contour lines and Terrain);
‚Ä¢ Nautical depths;
‚Ä¢ Offline Wikipedia;
‚Ä¢ Offline Wikivoyage - Travel guides.

OsmAnd Pro (subscription)
‚Ä¢ OsmAnd Cloud (backup and restore);
‚Ä¢ Cross-platform;
‚Ä¢ Hourly map updates;
‚Ä¢ Weather plugin;
‚Ä¢ Elevation widget;
‚Ä¢ Customise route line;
‚Ä¢ External sensors support (ANT+, Bluetooth);
‚Ä¢ Online Elevation profile.
summary: Navigation on hikes is no longer a problem. Download the map, put notes and go!

scraped_reviews.content: Fair map app. No address look up, just destination road & cross streets. Choosing destination on the map, but it may not show. Showed 2 houses on a street where there are 12. Routing is ok, does not look at traffic, says trip is 25mi. in 28 min., hour is likely. Rereroutes when you turn off. Sticks to major roads but suggest to many U-turns when changing path. Places are out of date by up to 5 yrs & some all out wrong, never had that name. Audio is good, some nice options there too. But ...
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
We use OpenStreetMap as a source of data. This map is built by a community of volunteers, availability of data in some areas depends on the number of volunteers. If you have any other questions please contact us at support@osmand.net

scraped_reviews.content: I have yet to try fully try the app out. I'm still setting it up. That said, they've already scored major points with me. other developers need to take notes on this. To use premium features, it will cost you $2.99/month, $29.99/yr, for a one-time fee of $39.99. I've already blacklisted other apps, regardless of their usefulness, for only giving me the option to purchase a one-year subscription. Good job, guys. üëçüòé
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Slade! Thank you for the feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: So far, it's a pretty awful app. Just tried my first track recording - after 2 miles, didn't record anything, though I started the recorder. The app is the opposite of intuitive or user-friendly. All I want to do is create a gps track so I can map trails. Seems like the simplest and most common use - that function should be very simple to get to and run, but in this awful app, it's not. I'll try it again once more, but I'm dubious.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello, Jay! Thank you for the feedback.

Please try to disable the energy-saving mode for OsmAnd, as it often closes apps running in the background. If this doesn't help, please contact us at support@osmand.net.

scraped_reviews.content: The app itself is great. However, after I clicked on a special offer within the app to upgrade to the Pro annual subscription (a pop-up banner at the top of the screen), they continued to charge me for the monthly subscription as well‚Äîevery month, for the entire year. I emailed customer support, and they told me there was nothing they could do and wouldn't issue a refund. Unethical...
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
We can not pause or stop user subscriptions automatically. Monthly and Annual subscription is two different products in Google Play so they available for purchase separately. We will work on UI to make sure user will be notified about current subscription.

scraped_reviews.content: These are open source maps, so not every business is listed, but you can save and organize locations. When I find a place that I want to remember, but isn't listed in the app, I mark it as a favorite. I love the fact that it offers navigation for walking, biking, and public transport. Great for English language Android users in Beijing.

want to like it but it's an obvious ploy to get your money. Map goes blank when you zoom in but if you zoom out you can see major roads & interstates. Downloading a State map is limited to 7. Deleting them does nothing. You HAVE to pay to get more than 7 states worth of maps. The whole experience is a bit confusing and other reviews share the same issues. I hate Google, but I'll tolerate the free Maps app and uninstall it when not in use, as opposed to... whatever this app is doing. Good luck!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.

To get more details, you can download the detailed "World overview" map. Alternatively, you can use online layers to see street-level details, but please note that these won't work for navigation or search. If you have any other questions, please contact us at support@osmand.net

scraped_reviews.content: I read that with this app you could customize what info you wanted shown on your map. I even read it would show road surface quality which would be awesome out here in the country. There was no setup tutorial and it wasn't user friendly at all. Maybe the review I read was way wrong, but even still I couldn't get directions, it said my starting point was too far from the nearest road. I live litterally 100 feet from a county road. The map only showed state highways and interstates. Useless.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Chad. To display the road surface, please open the Configure map menu - Details and select the required information. If you need any help, just open the Help section in the app menu, our website: https://osmand.net/features or contact us at support@osmand.net.

scraped_reviews.content: It's good, but lacks refinement with address searching. Doesn't find exact street number, often doesn't find streets due to mis-spellings in the map itself. Directions often go down non-connected streets or those that no longer exist for years. Can find some things by name, like schools, but is only about 75% accurate. Doesn't account for traffic. Features are good here, though. I like the overlay option and the offline maps, and setting parking spots, but interface takes getting used to.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
Could you please provide search examples so we could test them?
You can contact us at support@osmand.net.

scraped_reviews.content: Powerful free app with turn by turn guidance. The interface isn't the most intuitive, but it's very customizable. I wish you could easily "skip next waypoint", but it seems you must go into your route and manually delete it. That is a bit of a pain if you're navigating a complicated route and don't come near enough to a waypoint to clear it automatically.

Could use a bit of an update, the app takes a lot of battery especially when on the road. The UI could maybe use a rework too. But overall, the mapping works well for me though, shows almost all of the street names, and the location tracking is pretty good! This definitely is a great alternative to Google Maps though, especially for offline use.

OsmAnd app has functioned brilliantly for exploration during trail running, cycling, and motorcycling. The off-grid functionality is very useful, as many of the areas I explore do NOT have reliable cell coverage. I also especially appreciate the ability to easily use a GPX track, which I have created on my PC, then sent to my phone. OsmAnd is the easiest to use of the several similar app I have tried. An easy 5 out of 5 stars.

Severe handicap. 7 maps DOWNLOADS or updates. Not a 7 map collection, but consumable downloads. Deleted a few maps, hoping to 'free up some slots'. Wrong, none of that. Very handy, but now of limited use. I should just pony up, because it's a great app, but every time I've finally bought the "better product" I've been severely disappointed.

Much better than Google Maps for navigating by foot or by bike. User submissions makes all the little paths available, and makes sure that they are actually usable (or they wouldn't have been submitted). Offline maps work really well, too, even in back country. I always make sure to download the region if I plan to go hiking. Only downside compared to Google Maps is the user interface for navigation, which could still use some work. Wonderful project!

It's one of my favorite mapping apps that can work totally offline when the Internet is totally unavailable. Good for a backup then the net goes totally down in a TSHTF scenario. No WiFi, no cell service, no problem. Just use in conjunction with regular paper maps in a pinch. Plus sometimes pick up location information from WiFi hotspots without having to connect to them. It's like going to the mall and reading one of those YOU ARE HERE information boards. Just have it try to get your location.

Almost impossible to plan a route with multiple destinations unless you want to backtrack over 50% or more. This was never a good app for such route mapping, now it is just an excercise in utter frustration and essentially useless. If you need to plan more than a start point and end point, look elsewhereqa1. There is also a HUGE number of roads listed as paved that are actually dirt roads. Edit - it now only navigates from beginning to end point of existing loop routes. Ugh. Ended subscription.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello, Jeff! Thank you for the feedback.
Could you please provide more details about the issue?
You can contact us at support@osmand.net.

scraped_reviews.content: Gives directions very poorly, with very little notice. Doesn't say what street you're turning on most of the time, and is constantly "recalculating" even when you follow the directions. Worst navigation app I've tried yet.  EDIT: I tried it on several routes in Albuquerque, NM, and it never gave more than 2/10 mile notice about a turn, except on the freeway, where it gave 4/10 mile.  The only street names it gave for turns were the major intersections.  Residential, business, or even minor through-streets were rarely, if ever, named.  Thinking about it, I suppose it's possible that this was why the app kept saying "recalculating," since I had no way to verify if I was turning on the correct street, or a street too early, since the only notice I got was 2/10 mi or "turn right."
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
Could you please provide coordinates of the route? So we can check it.

scraped_reviews.content: It's quite a navigation app, I'll give it that much but I can't give it more than 3 stars unfortunately, no matter how much I'd like to. First, the search sucks. Don't count on being able to look up an address even if the place you're going to has been there for a few hundred years. Second, the TTS sounds horrible. I understand that's Google TTS but given that's the best option for this app, it stinks. Third, this makes my phone blazing hot. Finally, it doesn't work on Android Auto without yet another add on and a rooted device. I really want to like this app but the more I use it the more I go back to the one map I'm trying to get away from!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello. Please send us the address at support@osmand.net, so we could check if this is an OsmAnd issue or this data is simply absent in OpenStreetMap resource. Also, kindly note, that you can use different TTS engine compatible with your language and choose between TTS and recorded voice guidance files.

scraped_reviews.content: Though it takes a while to learn how it all works, OsmAnd is a powerful navigation tool. Once you optimize each preset, like one for hiking and one for driving, it's easy to switch dozens of settings easily. So your driving preset can have a simple road map that orients the map to your direction of travel, while the hiking preset can have topo and satellite overlays (simultaneously!) and bearing readout without map rotation. And all of this can be set up for offline use, which is wonderful

I was looking to turn my old phone into an offline GPS nav system.  This app looked like it would be great for that.  I download the map for my state and tried to type in a few addresses to which I wanted to navigate.  It could only seem to find landmarks or named buildings, but not a simple street address.    A navigation system that doesn't have that feature is worthless to me.  I removed the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello. Please, make sure to update the World overview map. Also, you can try to start the search with a city. To do this, please go to OsmAnd menu - Search - Address - Select the city first. After typing the city, choose it from the list and continue to type the street name and number. If the issue persists please contact us at support@osmand.net.

scraped_reviews.content: Not user friendly, so many issues. 1. Must search buc-ee's, not buc-ees. 2. Doesn't find routes for long trips. 3. Only searches your immediate area. 4. Can't seem to find the city I want it to go to. 5. Wants me to download more states that it shouldn't need for the route. 6. view on map option when searching shows nothing on map. If you have perfect punctuation, pay to download all states, have short trips, and enter exact addresses then it might work for you.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
Please contact us at support@osmand.net and provide coordinates of the start and destination points of the route so we could test it.

scraped_reviews.content: The existence of Open Street Map is wonderful, and this app is a very useful interface for OSM. I've been using it for some years. I like to use it to track hikes for milage and route, and to see what points of interest (POI) are around, and I've used to navigate while driving when I didn't have mobile signal (e.g. in central PA and in Canada).... There are many options, which can be difficult to navigate at first, but you'll come to appreciate all the options.

Can be a frustrating to learn but worth the effort. If you have become accustomed to one of the big name commercial applications the number of options in OsmAnd can be overwhelming to set up/use. There will be times when you will be surprised at things that "pop up" or possibly disappear for no apparent reason but spend a day or two playing with it and it will all make sense. The learning process is why I did not give it 5 stars but, once mastered, it is worth 5 stars.

Worst map ever. Put in an address to test it and it tried to route me the opposite direction! As i continued to drive in the right direction (east instead of west like it was trying to take me) it kept trying to route me to the next exit to turn around. If i didn't actually know this address I would have gone the wrong way into heavier traffic conditions. Can't trust it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Please send us the coordinates of the starting and ending points of your route, so we could check that, at support@osmand.net.

scraped_reviews.content: An essential app. Never an issue with maps becoming expired & deleted out from under your feet like 'That Map App' we all are first given  However, I would like to make a feature request, as there's a few things missing that ought to be important  When you have recorded and or imported tracks as much as I have, you will find that there's no way to decide if you should delete a track while in the GPX menu. There needs to be a way to 'show track on map', in order to decide if it's important  It would also be nice if the track log menu could organize tracks based on wherever the on map locator has been left at, either the current location, or when you move the locator to a intended destination  The track recordings are named by date & time, but after a year goes by, I couldn't recall which day I was at any particular location. So when it comes time to go back to a favorite campsite, or whatever it is, I have no practical way to choose the correct recording. This is why organizing the tracks by map position would be very useful  For GPX users, look at: android/data/net.osmand/files/tracks Custom tracks can go here. Recorded tracks are in the 'rec' folder

I love that this app is not creepy, and doesn't steal/sell your data, and the UI seems easy to use (looks recently updated). BUT I can't give higher than 1 star, because it completely failed to find any addresses at all. I understand it's based on an open source map, but really, navigating to an address is the only thing a driving nav app needs to do well.

I too was hoping to use this app to de-Google, but there are just so many gotchas in the UI that I can't justify the time to learn it. I tried several times to navigate a long bike ride, but couldn't find a straightforward way to enter an address & navigate there (much less enter a business name), and I'm a developer! I'm baffled that an app for mapping places & routes would require going into sub-menus in order to enter a destination. Until OsmAnd gets serious about UX design I'm out.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Eric! Thank you for the feedback. You can try to open Menu ‚Äì Directions ‚Äì Start/Destination ‚Äì Address or thru Search ‚Äì Address find the needed point, open context menu, and tap "Directions". If you have any other questions please contact us at support@osmand.net

scraped_reviews.content: A bit greedy with map limits. Only allowed 7 region downloads ever without paying, and you don't get those slots back if you delete a region you don't need anymore. Also if you delete and re-download the same region, or update a region, that counts as another download.. So realistically you'll run out very quickly if you want a usable experience offline, making it impossible for a longer road trip or travel to detailed areas like Japan with many "regions".
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Jacob! Thank you for the feedback. OsmAnd free version allows to download or update 7 maps for free. You can get unlimited map downloads and updates by purchasing "Maps+" in-app. If you have any other questions please contact us at support@osmand.net

scraped_reviews.content: This app has so much raw power and potential, I've actually purchased the paid version on a different account before. Unfortunately it's extremely hard to use as a drop in replacement for driving since it does not have any obvious way to specify a numbered address, it only seems willing to direct me to the street or road itself, and asking it a specific number on that road might not work. Edit: I'm seeing that this may be a problem with open map's data. Other than that and some optimizing, gr8!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
You can search or specify the address in Menu ‚Äì Search ‚Äì Address ‚Äì Select city, here you can find a step-by-step address search.
If it doesn't help, please contact us at support@osmand.net

scraped_reviews.content: Mediocre at first. Then I actually really like it now. I have submitted thousands of map edits in my area and am building it out to help with providing an alternative to big tech maps. Things I learned. If editing, addresses on buildings only get updated on monthly map updates. Which typically happen at the end of the month for update cutoff and roll out for download within 2 weeks of end of the month. I look forward to continuing my contributions and putting places on the map!

I was hoping this could replace Ozi (for decent maps) and CoPilot (for satnav). But it falls way short as a satnav. You can‚Äôt search for a UK postcode, let alone house numbers, and you can‚Äôt import a route from elsewhere. The interface is confusing, with 3 different ways to specify a route, each with its own set of options. And if you‚Äôre delivering, ‚Äòdoor-to-door‚Äô routing just doesn‚Äôt work as it should. On the road, turning instructions are too late and don‚Äôt describe roundabouts properly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello, Graham! Thank you for the feedback.
UK postcodes are not free, community members made additional file for it https://github.com/hvdwolf/OsmAnd-UKpostcodes/releases. Could you please provide details about route you are trying to import? You can contact us at support@osmand.net.

scraped_reviews.content: So Complicated! I wanted to get away from Google tracking and this seemed so promising but it feels like you need a basic degree in programming to use this. I travel alot and need to be able to load info and go and also use while driving, to find, change or add things. But this is not easy right out of the gate. I know its not Google maps, and of course I expected a bit of a learning curve. But I really wish it was easier to use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello. Please use the Help section in OsmAnd menu or this information: https://osmand.net/features. If you have any questions, please contact us at support@osmand.net

scraped_reviews.content: You are limited to download 7 maps (in my case states) which I didn't initially realise but is fine. While learning how to use the app I downloaded 7 states that I had taken a motorcycle trip through and it worked great. Then I deleted the states thinking that I could just replace those with new states. I was wrong. Not only no new states but, I can't get the old ones either! The app is now completely useless unless you want to look at a blank outline of the continent! Total waste of time!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello, Duncan! Thank you for the feedback. 
The free version of OsmAnd has a limit to download/update 7 maps, not for slots.

If you need more maps or every week updates, you can get OsmAnd Unlimited in-app purchase that unlocks download limit, or get OsmAnd Live subscription to unlock all paid features + every hour map updates.

scraped_reviews.content: OsmAnd is a must when I'm mountain biking. It shows trails you won't find on Google and you can add your own custom markers to the map. The compass feature is a life saver and GPX logging basically leaves a breadcrumb trail on your map. The tracks auto-save so you can look at them again later. I can't believe this incredible app is free!

I really do love this app for off-grid navigation. It's really really really powerful and not at all intuitive. Many of the functions are buried in menus and submenus, so something as s simple as uploading and following a GPX file is really tedious. I also wish it could work off of routes developed on Basecamp or something. That said, it has all the features you could want, and is my main nav for more complex trips. For simple nav, I just use Google Maps and download the maps.

I really want to like this app, and it's really good for offline capabilities, but it really falls short as an alternative to Google maps. Particularly when it comes to search functionality. Whether searching for businesses or addresses, the correct answer is almost never near the top. As a result I've resorted to using osmand for navigation and I still use Google maps for searching for locations.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello, Luke! Thank you for the feedback.
Could you please provide search phrase examples so we can test it? You can contact us at support@osmand.net.

scraped_reviews.content: The best offline map you can hope to get, but the GPS either has to have no voice prompts or LITERALLY informs you of the new calculated route time every 15 seconds with no way to turn that off. GPS would be absolutely perfect if I could just turn every voice prompt off except where to turn. Edit: voice prompts fixed; my only other desire here is the ability to plot your own routes and have the voice prompts follow it. Bonus points if it can recalculate based on your chosen route.

It shows promise, but at this time, I find its usefulness a bit limited. If I put an address into a calendar entry, for example, and then tap it and open with this app, it often cannot find it. It is more useful when browsing the map to find something manually, if you have a good idea about where it is you're looking for. I recognize that part of this has to do with the particular map source I have selected, and that can only get better over time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
Which calendar app do you use? Sometimes calendar apps share addresses in different formats, we already fix a few of them.
You can contact us at support@osmand.net.

scraped_reviews.content: Great map but not very intuitive. Cannot figure out how to export gpx files. Searched and searched for a way to delete routes. Only found one way through the map configuration screen. Not exactly where it think it would be. Cannot add a group or folder to the My Places screen. A folder has to be created during the edit of the saved/marked location.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
You can export GPX from My Places > Tracks, or from Settings ‚Äì Export to file.
If you have any other questions please contact us at support@osmand.net

scraped_reviews.content: Best map for Android Auto and navigation is good. Problems in the app all revolve around address searches. Many destinations are not in its database and if you don't know the number and street address, you're out of luck finding a destination. Adding favorites is also a problem; I still can't figure out how to add a favorite. I have a Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra and drive a 2021 Honda CRV E-XL.

This is my favorite app for bicycle routes. It's hands down better than any of the other top maps out there. Waze doesn't even have a bicycle route option. It lags a little bit but that's okay I can deal with it because I really do enjoy using the app for my bicycle routes.

Basically awesome. Completely local offline maps that blow Google Maps out the water. With GPS it not only shows the actual building I live in but that my flat is at the rear. Dozens of overlays like bus/train/cycling routes, contour lines, topography, etc.

So I just downloaded this app at the suggestion of Tom's Guide. I've been hiking for over 50 years, and can do it the old way and or the new way. Tom's Guide is useless for me. I uninstalled it after 10min. The key issue for me, is it doesn't allow one to find new trails easily. Or at all. Unless you know a rough starting point and zoom right in. One should be able to see All trails in a region without wasting time zooming in and out, in and out, in and out..... Very poor if low battery also.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for the feedback. We have plans to improve route visibility from higher zoom levels. Currently, Search > Routes can be used to filter and search routes. By tapping 'Show on map,' they can be viewed on the map.

scraped_reviews.content: The app is good, has all the features you'd expect and more. Though sometimes the icon defaults to a star when adding a favorite location, and it's not made clear that the number of maps you can download is limited. I was halfway through downloading a neighboring country when it notified me that I'm out of downloads, and deleting those maps doesn't let you download others or redownload what was deleted. Now I have no choice but to buy or subscribe to get maps of regions I'm interested in.

Using free version. Navigating to a place about 200km away from home, this app found a good route and was providing correct voice guidance. However, on the way back the app suggested a different route and started announcing "take the first exit" at all junctions, even though the screen was showing the correct exit and most of the time it was not the first exit. The moment I deviated from the suggested route the app was forever trying to make me drive on minor local roads.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thank you for the feedback.
Please contact us at support@osmand.net and provide coordinates of the start and destination points of the route so we could test it.

scraped_reviews.content: Free version unusable, to use the map and zoom in you need to download that part of the map, so you do that. But after a number of downloads it tells you that unlimited downloads are only available in the payed plans. Thus you delete some downloads (because I thought there is a limit on downloads at the same time), but that does not make it possible to download other map regions (there is just an absolute limit to map downloads). Very disappointed, the payed version isn't cheap either..
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Timothy! Thank you for the feedback. OsmAnd free version allows to download or update 7 maps for free. You can get unlimited map downloads and updates by purchasing "Maps+" in-app. If you have any other questions please contact us at support@osmand.net

scraped_reviews.content: It cannot even get one destination in the map even though the map is installed. It gives some related destinations not even available in the country. The navigation map is rudimentary compared to Google maps. It keeps asking to increase the search radius. Maps get strangely located geographically if I keep zooming in and out. Of course, in all fairness it is absolutely free, so should I even complain.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for the feedback. Please contact us at support@osmand.net and provide coordinates of the start and destination points of the route so we could test it.

scraped_reviews.content: Works well for logging roads and finding your way around while hunting. Roads here are all grid work and if not paying attention you can easily get disoriented.

cannot find common addresses. even after you find the separate address tab (which is a ridiculous UI fail)... ridiculous.... then limits search radius .... also ridiculous (only saves the data).... then you can only download offline data 7 times before paying 45 (CAD) for the pro version.... it's not Google on the front-end.... the one positive.... could be on the back end though. either way, not usable.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. Could you please contact us at support@osmand.net and provide an example of the search address?

scraped_reviews.content: Truly an amazing app, just the kind of Map I needed! Highly customizable and I can download only specific cities so I can download places before going there to be prepared regardless of the internet availability. Love the marking system, it's the best! So fun when hanging out with friends using this to navigate and locating myself via the distance of other marked locations, the icons allow me to really gamify the whole navigating experience

I love the concept, and it has so much potential. I'm tired of big tech selling my data. Some features aren't free because Osmand doesn't do that. It mostly works well, but the search functionality is pretty terrible. Sometimes, I'll enter a full address, and the results are bizarre. If they improve the search, it'll be a solid choice. I do realize that some of the issues are actually with OpenStreetMap. As others have said, marking destinations ahead of time makes the app practical.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, Jim! We're actively improving our search functionality. Please send us an example of your search address to support@osmand.net so we can look into this.

title: Harry Potter: Puzzles & Spells
description:
It‚Äôs time to experience the magic and mystery of Harry Potter like never before! Prepare to cast spells, shatter challenges, and celebrate the whimsy of the Wizarding World while becoming enchanted by this incredible free puzzle game for your mobile device! Combine gems and prove your Match 3 skill by beating levels to upgrade and unlock new spells and magic abilities which will aid your quest to conquer more difficult Match 3 puzzles. Get a chance to upgrade your spells as you prepare for the magically mischievous Match 3 challenges ahead in these fun free games.

As you progress in your Harry Potter: Puzzles & Spells Match 3 saga, unlock classic moments from the films, including Harry, Ron and Hermione toppling trolls, Fred & George playing pranks, and Hagrid taking care of his magical creatures at Hogwarts! Learn more about the wonders of the Wizarding World and Hogwarts as you collect magical creatures that will aid in solving the puzzles of this Match 3 game! So get ready to ‚Äòswish and flick‚Äô your way to a magical journey of your very own in whimsical matching games!

Solve Match 3 challenges featuring the original Wizarding World characters from the Harry Potter films! Merge gems to develop your magic skills by progressing through innovative Match 3 puzzle play where you‚Äôll master Spells and enjoy an endless array of Daily Events that continue to delight and surprise even very adept Match 3 puzzle experts.

Level-up Your Abilities: Earn experience points throughout the game to increase your level, unlock rewards and gain magic abilities that assist you to crush each new fantastical Match 3 puzzle.Solve riddles to find new accessories to help your gameplay, such as the broom, or Bombastic Bombs, which can clear your board of gems & jewels with a crash of explosion!

Unlock & Upgrade Spells: Use a burst of Spells to solve puzzles by smashing explosive obstacles and blast hazards like Chocolate Frogs and Potions. 

Celebrate the Magic of Harry Potter: As you solve free puzzles, celebrate the most memorable moments from the Harry Potter stories. Follow your favorite witches and wizards, or win a game of Wizard's Chess! The Daily Prophet will keep you up to date with Harry, Ron and Hermione as they progress on their epic journey at Hogwarts!

Play In Clubs: Unite with other players in your club to climb the leaderboard. Taste sweet victory as you work with your Clubmates to win tournaments and challenges against other clubs!

Amass Glorious Collections: As you progress in your free Match 3 mastery, you'll gain a collection of marvelous Wizarding World creatures that aid you in solving puzzles. Work on your collection and receive a marvelous beast that will deliver benefits that directly assist you as you match 3 gems to solve challenging puzzles.

Enjoy Daily Events: Take part in new and exciting events every day! Collect treasure as you celebrate characters‚Äô Birthdays, and upgrade spells as you witness a multitude of magical Harry Potter moments!

ADDITIONAL DISCLOSURES
For specific information about how Zynga collects and uses personal or other data, please read our privacy policy at https://www.zynga.com/privacy/policy. Use of this application is governed by the Zynga Terms of Service, found at https://www.zynga.com/legal/terms-of-service. The game is free to play, however in-app purchases are available for additional content and premium currency. 
Harry Potter: Puzzles & Spells game is FREE to download and includes optional in-game purchases (including random items). Information about drop rates for random item purchases can be found in-game. If you wish to disable in-game purchases, please turn off the in-app purchases in your phone or tablet‚Äôs Settings.

HARRY POTTER: PUZZLES & SPELLS TM & ¬© Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. Software code ¬© Zynga Inc. PORTKEY GAMES and WIZARDING WORLD characters, names, and related indicia are ¬© & TM Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. Publishing Rights ¬© JKR. (s24)

scraped_reviews.content: I've been playing this game for 4 years. Recently it started saying not to exit the game or you'd not get your reward. After playing a difficult game and spending my coins to get extra moves, it froze for about 30 seconds or so. I checked my internet connection and it was fine. My only option was to close the game. When I re-opened it, I was still on the same game but my coins were still gone. It doesn't seem fair. Why is the game freezing when it never did that before?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jo, sorry to hear this happened to your game. We hope you will allow us to discuss this with you further. Please copy and open this link on your browser: https://zynga.support/HPM3ContactSupport to contact our player support team for further assistance.

scraped_reviews.content: It used to be fun until it became a money grab. Skill is no longer needed. Power ups don't do half of what they are supposed to. Too bad, it could have been a great game if they simply let skill and fun be the focus. I think ppl would still have spent money. I rarely play anymore because it's just frustrating, no fun or relaxation anymore. Only gave 2 stars because of the graphics and variety of games within the game. All of which are more money grabs, by the way, so don't bother.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We appreciate your feedback and share your disappointment regarding the shift in gameplay focus. It‚Äôs important for us to hear how the balance of skill and enjoyment has affected your experience. Thank you for highlighting the graphics and variety; we‚Äôre glad you found some positives. Your insights will help us strive for a better experience.

scraped_reviews.content: Hardest part about this game lately is simply escaping the ads. The monopoly one forces open the play app and I kept trying to close out the ad and I kept ending up back at the store to where I just gave up and shut down the game. And many feel excessively long with multiple windows to ex out of to where it's not worth the struggle. I rather just lose the game
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Topher, we are sorry about the ads. We are continuously working to improve the ad experience. We will improve in the future and will try to keep the ads from interfering.

scraped_reviews.content: Used to love this game. And put up with watching an ad or two for more moves. But now there's a constant banner of ads at the top. The ads are on and changing as soon as you start your first move. It's very distracting. You're trying to focus on your playing, but you can't with that new banner on top of the gameboard. I'll probably uninstall if it continues.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Michele. Sorry to hear about your experience, and we appreciate your feedback about the ad banner in the game. Your feedback helps us improve the game for the better. For gameplay concerns, please get in touch with our Player Support Team https://zynga.support/HPM3ContactSupport so we can take a closer look. Thanks for playing!

scraped_reviews.content: this game has gone thru lots of changes over the years, none of which improved it, but I draw the line at ads playing ON the screen with my game. Zynga definitely made it worse, and if I'm playing your game at that moment, I don't want to see ads for games that are literally nothing like this game. severe disappointment from where the game started back in its day, and inconsistencies in gameplay have gone up. Now ads are shrinking the game screen, and I'm totally done with this game and Zynga.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Sable. We understand that ads can be overwhelming at times, and we appreciate feedback. Your input helps us improve, and we hope you continue to enjoy your gaming experience!

scraped_reviews.content: This used to be my favorite game to play, but their last update was awful. They shrunk the puzzle to be tiny and now have a large banner at the top with rolling ads. Not only are the ads incredibly distracting, but it made the game really suck to play. It's very disappointing, and now I have to find a new game to play that doesn't shove ads in my face.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Morgan! Sorry to hear you are unsatisfied with the progress of the updates. We constantly update the game by adding/removing features to make it better. I hope you can enjoy our app again in the future.

scraped_reviews.content: I am a long time player(5+ years). My husband created a new account after his was lost and he hadn't played in a year. Now the game has an ad banner which makes it very distracting to play and takes away the calmness. Suggestion: Remove the banner from in game play and add silly hats, hair, clothes, and/or glasses for the player's avatar. It is sorely missing and would generate revenue without alienating your player base. I expect the banner ads are coming for me soon in a rolling update.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Sarah, thank you very much for your review. We are always looking to improve the experience for our users, and really appreciate the feedback. If there is anything specific we can look into, please contact us through the in-game support feature that can be found in the game settings for further assistance.

scraped_reviews.content: Excellent game. Well done! However, they offer the option of 5 extra moves by watching 3 ads... This is ok when it works. But, it should give the free moves even if adds aren't available. I also believe the free moves should always be available by viewing commercials. Sometimes they want you to buy the free moves and this is annoying.

scraped_reviews.content: Was once a great game. You could play casually and complete levels and events. But difficulty changed in early 2025. Now you need to buy extra moves or watch 3 back-to-back ads to complete most levels. It became impossible to complete all Season event levels, even playing a couple hours every day. It's a game not a job! Stopped playing around then and recently tried it again. It's even WORSE! Same difficulty but now many ads are 2+ minutes each! Horrible.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ken. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We are working diligently to improve our product every day to enhance your experience.

scraped_reviews.content: *UPDATE* Support is horrible. They never correct any issues. I've played for years. It's always the same answer, no help. I played the Missions game, which lasts a week. My "daily bonus" didn't register for 1 day, so I didn't get the end reward after completing every task for a week (there are a lot). So, instead of correcting the glitch where I can receive my full reward, they gave me 30 minutes of play. This is unacceptable. Second time this happened. They see my logins but act like I'm a liar

Rest assured that we are diligently working to make the game more enjoyable to play. For game issues, please reach out to our Player Support team by tapping on the Support tab found in Settings and providing your Player ID. Thank you.
